story.description: * Only annotations driven * Only simple type of options, string, boolean, integer, double * Options are mapped to setters only * Only actions with no options are supported
story.name: version 0.5

note.text: Published at https://repository-ushkinaz.forge.cloudbees.com/release/com/googlecode/commandme/commandme/0.5/
note.author: Dmitry Sidorenko

story.description: HelloWorld greet --no-heartly We need to decide on standard inverse naming
story.name: Short form of boolean option, false
Use short names of any types of options

story.description: HelloWorld -h -D Upper case means false lower case means true
story.name: Shortest form of boolean options
Default help facility will use list of all actions and options with optional descriptions

story.description:
true: true 1 yes
false: false 0 no
if anything else raise an exception
story.name: Support flexible values for booleans

story.description: * Actions with options are supported. Options are separated to global and action-specific * Custom exception handling
story.name: version 1.0

story.description:
Consequent call to an option is considered as multiple value set HelloWord --name John --name Dave
Option setter method can have following declaration setter(Type value) - multiple calls setter(Collection<Type> value) setter(<Type> value...)
story.name: Multiple Arguments for a single option
Support creation of generic objects for passing as options

note.text: Not sure if we need it
note.author: Dmitry Sidorenko

story.name: Clustering short options if none requires values

story.description: Sometimes it is useful to allow many different options to share the same meaning in the program that uses them.
story.name: Synonyms of Options

story.description: * Complex option types, automatic creation of option value objects
story.name: version 3.0

story.description: http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/basedefs/xbd_chap12.html Guideline 10: The argument -- should be accepted as a delimiter indicating the end of options. Any following arguments should be treated as actions, even if they begin with the '-' character. The -- argument should not be used as an option or as an action.
story.name: Special treatment for "--"

story.description: Can specify separator for optional value
story.name: Concise Specification of Multiple Arguments for an Option
Pass integer options in radix different from 10
